title: \*\*\*\*Help needed to ID gothic type font\*\*\*\*
content:
Hi looking for this font, looks simislar to many gothic, blackletter, and oldeglish fonts but has script type swirls. i had this font once so i know its not a manipulation. please help

BigMikee

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924020504im_/http:/typophile.com/files/attiude_6550.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [attiude.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924020504/http:/typophile.com/files/attiude.jpg) | 51.89 KB |
author: bigmikee

comments.content:
I would assume its custom made.  
Based on the fact that all three lowercase t  
are different.
this is one of those fonts that has all lower case so u have 2-3 types for some letters and has adtional swerls. i know it aint custom cos i have had it before. silly me now cant find it :(
ok i know i had this font if i can remeber its a open type font and if any of you know about them they can have multiples of the same character, plz help

[Agincourt](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924020504/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/david-quay/agincourt/) seems to be close.

Whenever I find a match for the “d” and “e”, the “a” is open. This leads me to believe that the “a” may have been modified, or that there is more than one face here.

Graet font and a nice composition.
